questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about the Holy Spirit?

choices.answer: it came to the disciples during Pentecost
it is God in the form of a human
it is God in the form of a spirit
it is part of the trinity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about the Pentecost?

choices.answer: it occured 50 days after the death of Jesus
God came down to the disciples int he form of the Holy Spirit
it use to be a Jewish feast that celebrated the grain harvest
it was the beginning of Christianity

questions.question: How did Pentecost change the behaviour of the followers of Jesus?

choices.answer: it allowed the disciples to go share the news of the resurrection to Mary
it didn't change the behaviour of the followers of Jesus
it allowed the disciples to share the news of the resurrection in tongues
it gave the disciples the courage to look at Jesus on the cross

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason the Holy Spirit is present in our lives?

choices.answer: to help us achieve God's expectations
to help us do what we want

questions.question: What are the gifts of the Holy Spirit?

choices.answer: gifts that God gives us to help fulfill His will for us
gifts that God gives us to help us fulfill our own will for ourselves
gifts that we get from our friends to show us that they care about us
the blessings that come to us because we have done God's will

questions.question: When people help to change things to they way they should be and make good judgments they are displaying the gift of:
When people see how God wants things & know what needs to be done to help God's plan, they are displaying the gift of:
When people can see why things are the way they are & respond the way God wants them to, they are displaying the gift of
What are the fruits of the Holy Spirit?

choices.answer: gifts that God gives us to help us to fulfill His will for us
gifts that God gives us to help us to fulfill our own will
the blessings that come to us because we have done God's will
the blessings that come to us because we have done our own will

questions.question: Which of the following are fruits of the Holy Spirit?
There are ___ gifts of the Holy Spirit and ___ fruits of the Holy Spirit.
What is the Trinity?

choices.answer: God (the Father), Jesus (the Son) and the Holy Spirit
a religious term referring to the bread that we eat during mass
God (the Father), Jesus (the Son) and ourselves

questions.question: What does the Trinity call us to do?

choices.answer: to live our lives base on our own thoughts about what is right and wrong
to live a good life and to help only those that we want to

questions.question: What does solidarity mean?

choices.answer: to see others as more important than our own needs
to see others needs as just as important as our own needs
to see our own needs as more important than the others needs
to not care about either our needs or others needs

questions.question: _____ is calling on the Holy Spirit to lead or give direction about our vocation.
Which of the following does NOT relate to holiness?

choices.answer: a holy person sees and responds to God in both big and small ways
a holy person sees the good in every situation
when we are holy, we are fully alive
a holy person sees and responds to God in big ways only

questions.question: There are ____ aspects of holiness
Which of the following is NOT one of the aspects of holiness?

choices.answer: being called and calling to others
belonging and inviting others to belong
being kind and offering kindness to others

questions.question: What is a sacrament?

choices.answer: a living encounter with a priest or nun
a visible sign of God's invisible grace
an encounter with a representative of God

questions.question: There are ______ sacraments in the Catholic faith?
Which of the following are the three sacraments of initiation?

choices.answer: baptism, confirmation and anointing of the sick

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the commitments made during the sacraments of initiation?

choices.answer: to experience all the sacraments before we die
to love God and God's people
to accept forgiveness and try to be forgiving
that we must reach out to all those in need

questions.question: What do the sacraments of initiation promote?
___ is given to persons after he/she comes out of the water of baptism as a symbol that they are now "clothed in Christ"
_____ is a sign that Christ brings light to the life of a baptized person?
_____ is a sign that the gift of the Holy Spirit and represents the sharing of love, strength, support and encouragement

choices.answer: the laying on of the hands

questions.question: Reconciliation is:

choices.answer: when a priest forgives you for your sins
offered to the sick to help heal them of physical and spiritual sickness
offered to those who are sick to help heal their spirit
when a priest offers God's forgiveness to those who have sinned

questions.question: Which of the following are the two healing sacraments?

choices.answer: anointing of the sick and reconciliation
anointing of the sick and eucharist

questions.question: What are the healing sacraments a sign of?

choices.answer: that there is no hope if we are sick or have sinned

questions.question: What does "Catholic" mean?
There are _____ models of the church.
Which of the following is NOT one of the models of the church?
Why are there different models of the church?

choices.answer: so that everyone can be included in the church
to attract only the types of people that the church wants
so that certain people can be included in the church
to attract people of a select social status

questions.question: What is the main task of the church and all of its members?

choices.answer: to make sure the church is decorated beautifully
making the love of God available to all
making the love of God only available to members of the church
making the love of God available to those following the Ten Commandments

questions.question: What are the sacraments of service?
Which of the following is NOT a reason why the sacraments of service model faithful service for us?

choices.answer: they help us to understand what it means to love fully and give freely
they teach us to love our partner/God only when things are good in life

questions.question: What is the best example of perfect and true love?

choices.answer: a friend buying a gift for their friend
Jesus Christ who gave His life for us on the cross

questions.question: What does "apostle" mean?
What of the following is NOT true about the "Creed"?

choices.answer: it is a common profession of our faith
it is written to make sure all Catholics fully understand what they believe
it plays a minor role in the Catholic faith

questions.question: What does the Communion of Saints refer to?

choices.answer: a community of believers both living and dead
